original_conversation.content: [frustrated] I can't believe this is happening. They just—they literally just fired me for the missing deposit from Tuesday. [pause] And I'm standing there like, um, trying to explain that I wasn't even working the closing shift that night. [angry] But Karen, she's just sitting there nodding along like she doesn't know exactly what happened. [bitter] She knows. She absolutely knows because she's the one who— [sigh] God, I saw her take that bag to her car. [shaky voice] I actually saw her do it and I didn't say anything because, I mean, who's gonna believe the part-time bagger over the shift supervisor? [mocking] "Oh, we have to maintain store standards." [furious] Standards? Really? While she's literally stealing and I'm the one getting canned for it? [very sad] Three years. Three years I've been there, never missed a shift, never had a complaint. [laugh] And now I'm, what, supposed to just accept this? [anxious] I need this job. I really, really need this job. subject: Getting fired from your grocery bagging job for something your supervisor actually did
